SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: Diameter of the Kill Zone;Diameter of the Zone of Inhibition
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A measurement of the diameter of the circular region of bacteria growth inhibition that surrounds an antibiotic source on the surface of a cultured plate.
An indication as to whether the pre-specified mutations of interest are present in the subject.

An indication of reduced or increased susceptibility of a microbial organism, or activity of a biological/biochemical reaction in response to the inhibitory concentration (IC50 and/or IC95) of a specific drug.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Baseline
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of population growth or replication of a microbial organism. (NCI)
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Baseline

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Ref;Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Reference
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism. It is a ratio calculated by the EC50 Subject Result divided by the EC50 Reference Control Result. (NCI)
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Microbial EC50 Fold Change from Reference

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism. (NCI)

A measurement of titer of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition of the population growth or replication of a microbial organism. (NCI)
A measurement that specifies the minimum concentration of the agent at which organism growth was inhibited.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Baseline
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism. It is a ratio calculated by the current IC50 Subject Result divided by the IC50 Subject Result from the baseline visit.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Baseline

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Ref;Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Reference
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism. It is a ratio calculated by the IC50 Subject Result divided by the IC50 Reference Control Result.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Microbial IC50 Fold Change from Reference

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

A measurement of biological/biochemical reaction of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 50 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: IC95 Fold Change from Baseline;Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Baseline
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism. It is a ratio calculated by the current IC95 Subject Result divided by the IC95 Subject Result from the baseline visit.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Baseline

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: IC95 Fold Change from Reference;Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Ref
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A fold change based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism. It is a ratio calculated by the IC95 Subject Result divided by the IC95 Reference Control Result.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Microbial IC95 Fold Change from Ref

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: IC95 Reference Control Result;Microbial IC95 Reference Control Result
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A reference control sample response based on the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: IC95 Subject Result;Microbial IC95 Subject Result
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A measurement of biological/biochemical reaction of a microbial organism that has been exposed to the concentration of a specific drug expected to produce 95 percent inhibition on the enzymatic activity of a microbial organism.
A phenotypic or genotypic assessment of the response of the microbial organism to an antimicrobial agent.
An indication as to whether one or more scored mutations of interest that may confer susceptibility in the microorganism is present.
